item.description:
I am a recent graduate from Duke University with a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science. I have previously worked at Appian, a software company, both as a software engineer and a user experience designer. After a year of work in industry, I have decided to pursue a PhD in Computer Science. I am especially interested in the quantum computing software stack, and plan to do research on quantum computing compilation, simulation, debugging, and formal verification methods.

My research experience includes a summer as a research engineering technician with NIOSH, a division of the CDC. My research involved determining the most appropriate machine learning model, performing parameter selection, and implementing my findings as a computational model for classification of rat breathing data. Some rats had silicosis, a lung disease, and served as a representative model for human breathing. The results could be used to better classify human breathing data to help diagnose people who may have silicosis. My work was a rat-applicable extension of the article Classification of voluntary cough airflow patterns for prediction of abnormal spirometry, found here.
